# Question

Write a pig latin transformer called `pig_latinify` that operates on a vector of strings. It iterates over each string and changes it to pig latin. Each iteration should run on a separate thread.

```julia
using Base.Threads: @threads

function pig_latinify(text::Vector{String})
    @threads for i in 1:length(text)
        text[i] = pig_latinize(text[i])
    end
    return text
end

function pig_latinize(s::String)
    vowels = "aeiou"
    if s[1] in vowels
        return s * "way"
    else
        return substring(s, 2:) * s[1:end - 1] * "ay"
    end
end
```

This code defines a function `pig_latinify` that operates on a vector of strings. It uses the `@threads` macro to iterate over each string in the vector and apply the `pig_latinize` function to it. The `pig_latinize` function determines whether the first character of the input string is a vowel, and if so, appends "way" to the end; otherwise, it moves the first character to the end and appends "ay".
